{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Refining''' (also perhaps called by the mathematical term '''affining''') is the process of [[List of purification methods in chemistry|purification]] of a (1) [[chemical compound|substance]] or a (2) [[Theory of Forms|form]]. The term is usually used of a [[natural resource]] that is almost in a usable form, but which is more useful in its pure form. For instance, most types of natural [[petroleum]] will burn straight from the ground, but it will burn poorly and quickly clog an engine with residues and by-products. The term is broad, and may include more drastic transformations, such as the reduction of [[ore]] to [[metal]] (for which see [[Refining (metallurgy)]]).
The refining of [[liquid]]s is often accomplished by [[distillation]] or [[fractional distillation|fractionation]]; this process is useful, for example, for isolating different fractions of [[petroleum]]. [[Gas]]es can be refined in this way as well, by being cooled and/or compressed until they liquefy. Gases and liquids can also be refined by [[solvent extraction|extraction]] with a selective [[solvent]] that dissolves away either the substance of interest, or the unwanted impurities.
Many [[solid]]s can be refined by growing [[crystal]]s in a [[solution]] of the impure material; the regular structure of the crystal tends to favor the desired material and exclude other kinds of particles.
[[Chemical reaction]]s are often used to remove impurities of particular types.
The use of [[silicon]] and other [[semiconductor]]s in [[electronics]] depends on precise control of impurities. The [[zone melting]] process developed by [[William Gardner Pfann]] was used to produce pure [[germanium]], and subsequently [[float-zone silicon]] became available when Henry Theuerer of [[Bell Labs]] adapted Pfann's method to silicon.
Types of materials that are usually refined: * [[metal]]s - see [[Refining (metallurgy)]] * [[petroleum]] * [[silicon]] * [[sugar]] * [[table salt]] * [[vegetable oil]] * [[air]] * [[refining (glass)|glass]]
==See also== *[[Continuous distillation]] *[[Natural gas processing]] *[[Oil refinery]] *Refinery *[[Refining (metallurgy)]] *[[Wafer (electronics)]] *[[Air separation]]
[[Category:Industrial processes]]

'''Ricardo Poma''' (born 1946) is the [[Chief Executive Officer]] of the family owned [[Conglomerate (company)|conglomerate]] [[Grupo Poma]], based in [[San Salvador]], [[El Salvador]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eleconomista.net/2015/12/09/grupo-poma-el-valor-de-la-cultura-corporativa|title=Grupo Poma, el valor de la cultura corporativa|last1=Balcáceres|first1=Pablo|last2=Ibarra|first2=Leonel|date=9 December 2015|work=El Economista|language=Spanish|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6g2T2LMyk|archivedate=16 March 2016}}</ref>
Poma obtained an industrial engineering degree from [[Princeton University]] in 1967 and an [[MBA]] from [[Harvard Business School]] in 1970.<ref name="EDH">{{cite web|url=http://archivo.elsalvador.com/noticias/2001/10/2/negocios/negoc3.html|title=Ricardo Poma, ganador de "La Palma de Oro"|date=2 October 2001|work=El Diario de Hoy|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6g2TlKZAH|archivedate=16 March 2016}}</ref> When he returned to El Salvador, Ricardo joined the family business; he took the reins of the conglomerate from his father [[Luis Poma]] in the 1980´s. Nowadays, Ricardo Poma's three sons and two nephews are part of the family conglomerate participating in the different business divisions (including eldest son Fernando Poma); his younger brother Ernesto Poma is part of Transal, the company’s [[Miami]] division.
Ricardo Poma dedicates a significant amount of his time to social projects and institutions, such as the Salvadoran Foundation for Health and Human Development (FUSAL), the Advanced School of Business and Economics (ESEN) and Fundacion Poma, focusing on culture, education and health programs in El Salvador and Central America.<ref name="EDH" /> He is also a member of the President's Leadership Council of the [[Inter-American Dialogue]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thedialogue.org/experts/ricardo-poma/|title=Inter-American Dialogue {{!}} Ricardo Poma|website=www.thedialogue.org|access-date=2017-04-13}}</ref>
Poma was an early investor in [[Bain Capital]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2012/jul/19/nation/la-na-bain-creation-20120719/2|title=Bain Capital started with help of offshore investors|last1=Tanfani|first1=Joseph|last2=Mason|first2=Melanie|last3=Gold|first3=Matea|date=9 July 2012|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6g2UFL13g|archivedate=16 March 2016}}</ref>
==Notes== {{Reflist}}

{{Orphan|date=November 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Ryan Bethencourt | image = | caption = Bethencourt as a panelist at Techonomy Forum in March 2015 | occupation = biohacker, venture partner | birth_name = Ryan Bethencourt | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|mf=yes|1979|03|18}} | birth_place = [[Miami, Florida]], U.S. | website = {{URL|ryanbethencourt.com}} }}
'''Ryan Bethencourt''' (March 18, 1979) is a [[scientist]], [[entrepreneur]], and [[Do-it-yourself biology|biohacker]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jenniferhicks/2014/03/15/move-over-hackers-biohackers-are-here/|title=Move Over Hackers, Biohackers Are Here|date=15 March 2014|work=Forbes}}</ref> best known for his work as program director and venture partner at Indie.Bio, a biology accelerator and early stage seed fund.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2015/05/12/biotech-accelerator-indiebio-bumps-funding-to-250k-per-startup-to-give-founders-more-runway/|title=Biotech Accelerator IndieBio Bumps Funding To $250K Per Startup To Give Founders More Runway|date=12 May 2015|publisher=AOL|work=TechCrunch}}</ref> Bethencourt was head of [[life sciences]] at the [[X Prize Foundation|XPRIZE]] [[Foundation (nonprofit)|foundation]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://techonomy.com/2014/06/citizen-scientists-accelerate-bio-progress/|title=Citizen Scientists Accelerate Bio Progress|work=Techonomy}}</ref> a [[co-founder]] and [[CEO]] of Berkeley Biolabs, a [[biotechnology|biotech]] accelerator,<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.nature.com/naturejobs/science/articles/10.1038/nj7459-509a|title=Biotechnology: Independent streak|publisher=|doi=10.1038/nj7459-509a|volume=499|journal=Nature|pages=509–511}}</ref> and Halpin Neurosciences, an [[Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis|ALS]] [[therapeutics]]-focused biotech company.<ref>[http://www.bizjournals.com/sanfrancisco/print-edition/2012/07/20/biohackers-go-solo-in-quest-to-find.html ‘Biohackers’ go solo in quest to find cures]</ref> Bethencourt co-founded Counter Culture [[laboratory|Labs]], a [[citizen science]] nonprofit,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eastbayexpress.com/oakland/inside-the-ethical-cheese-lab/Content?oid=3998300|title=Inside the Ethical Cheese Lab|work=East Bay Express}}</ref> and Sudo Room, a [[hacker space]] based in downtown [[Oakland, California]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailycal.org/2014/01/27/new-hackerspace-berkeley-biolabs-opens-southwest-berkeley/|title=New hackerspace Berkeley BioLabs opens in southwest Berkeley - The Daily Californian|work=The Daily Californian}}</ref>
Bethencourt is a [[vegan]] and has worked on the development of several [[Sustainable products|sustainable]] and [[cruelty-free]] products.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fox|first=Katrina |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/katrinafox/2018/03/15/this-vegan-biohacker-is-set-to-launch-the-first-cultured-protein-foods-for-pets/#5daedb2b5fe7 |title=Why Wild Earth Cofounder Ryan Bethencourt Is Applying The Science Of 'Vegan Biohacking' To Pet Food|newspaper=[[Forbes]] |publicationdate= 15 March 2018|accessdate=15 March 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20180326171952/https://via.hypothes.is/https://www.forbes.com/sites/katrinafox/2018/03/15/this-vegan-biohacker-is-set-to-launch-the-first-cultured-protein-foods-for-pets|archivedate=26 March 2018}}</ref>
==Early life== Ryan has worked over the last decade in the biopharmaceutical industry to partner on and develop novel drugs from first IND submission to FDA approval with many major biopharmas including Pfizer, AZ, J&J, Sanofi, Takeda, Amgen, [[Genentech]], and other companies in the U.S., E.U., and [[Japan]]. He has also served as COO at Genescient Pharmaceuticals, a longevity focused biotech startup and CEO of Halpin Neurosciences, an ALS focused startup. Ryan’s work has been featured in Wired, TechCrunch, Forbes, the San Francisco Business Times, and other publications. He regularly speaks on biotech innovation and writes for Biocoder, an O’Reilly Media publication. He's also an author of Forbes, Techonomy and Huffington Post.
Since Ryan Bethencourt co-founded IndieBio in 2014, he and his team have funded 68 biotech startups, including companies building the post-animal bioeconomy: Clara Foods, Memphis Meats, Gelzen, New Wave, and Pembient. He's also an advisor of [[The Good Food Institute]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.RyanBethencourt.com/|title=Squarespace - Claim This Domain|publisher=}}</ref>
==Education== Ryan has a BSc degree in Biological Sciences (Molecular Genetics) from Warwick University in the United Kingdom. He also has a Masters in Bioscience Enterprise (MBE) from Cambridge University (2002 – 2003). This masters course was the first of its kind in the UK (launched in 2002) and it was a fusion of the MBA/Biotech courses and launched in partnership with Harvard and MIT. He's also been a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) Candidate at the Center for Regenerative Medicine at the University of Edinburgh in 2003 working on stem cell differentiation. .<ref>https://www.linkedin.com/in/bethencourt</ref>

• LAbLaunch
• IndieBIo
==Global Forum 2015== [[File:Ryan at Global Forum 2015.jpg|thumb|Ryan at Global Forum 2015 at Manila, Philippines]] Ryan joins the [http://www.forum2015.org/ Global Forum 2015] as one of the speakers. The Global Forum on Research and Innovation for Health 2015 aims to identify solutions to the world’s unmet health needs through research and innovation. The said forum was held on August 24–27, 2015 at Philippines International Convention Center(PICC), Metro Manila, Philippines. Ryan speaks about the topic of "Increasing public expenditure on research and innovation in emerging economies" and "Increasing investments for innovative andpractical solutions to priority healthcare".
==Pioneers Asia 2016== [[File:Ryan-Bethencourt-Indie-Bio.jpg|thumb|Ryan Bethencourt IndieBio at Pioneers Asia]] Ryan is a part of [[Pioneers.io|Pioneers Asia 2016]] on Mar 23, 2016 at Tokyo, Japan . Pioneers facilitates profound business relationships between tech innovators. The event is for tech entrepreneurs, investors, top executives, thought-leaders, and international media from Europe to Asia, Middle East, and beyond. Ryan speaks about BIOTECH FOR THE WORLD OF THE FUTURE. He also moderated the life sciences and agriculture topic on the said event.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Bethencourt, Ryan}} [[Category:American businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1979 births]] [[Category:Biotechnologists]]

revision.text:
{{No footnotes|date=June 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Dr. Simon N. Gicharu, CBS | image = Dr. Simon Gicharu, CBS, Founder and Chairman, Mount Kenya University.jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Dr. Simon Gicharu, CBS | birth_name = Simon Gicharu | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1964}} | birth_place = [[Gathiruini]], [[Kenya]] | nationality = Kenyan | alma_mater = '''[[Kenyatta University]]'''
{{small|([[Bachelor of Education]])}}
''' '''[[Cranfield University]]'''
{{small|Managing Enterprise Development}}
''' | occupation = [[Educationist]], [[Entrepreneur]] | years_active = 1993–present | home_town = [[Nairobi]] | spouse = 1 | title = '''Founder and Chairman, Board of Trustees'''
[[Mount Kenya University]] }} '''Dr. Simon Gicharu''' is an educationalist and founder of [[Mount Kenya University]], which is East and Central Africa’s largest private university. He was born in 1964 in Gathiruini village, in [[Kiambu|Kiambu County]], Kenya. He is the first in a family of seven. Dr. Gicharu is also the Chairman of the Rural Electrification Authority and National Private Universities Owners Association of Kenya. He is the founder of Equip Africa Institute and patron of the Graduate Enterprise Academy. He is also a board member at Thika Water and Sewerage Company, and the patron of Inter Universities Rover Moot under the [[The Kenya Scouts Association|Kenya Scouts Association]]. In 2015, Dr. Gicharu was named the Eastern African [[Ernst & Young|Ernst and Young]] Entrepreneur of the Year. He is married with three children. ==Early life and education== His early life experiences were the cauldron in which his successful characteristic traits were shaped. As a pupil at Kiawairia Primary School and later Gathiruini Secondary School, Gicharu had to walk many kilometres to and from school. His parents were peasant farmers and their small piece of land, which they tilled for subsistence, provided barely enough for their upkeep. To supplement the domestic income, Dr. Gicharu, alongside his siblings, picked coffee at large commercials farms where he was paid by the kilo. At Murang’a High School where he undertook his O-Levels, he was the captain in his final year. While in school, he etched a reputation for entrepreneurial acumen, and for assisting fellow students in Mathematics, a subject he excelled in. Mr Gicharu obtained a Bachelor of Education Science (Honours) degree from [[Kenyatta University]] in 1990. His majors were Mathematics and Chemistry. Soon after graduation, he continued to exercise his passion for education, teaching his favourite Maths subject at various secondary schools in Kenya, and later at the [[Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology]], and at the [http://wikimapia.org/9568852/Thika-Technical-Training-Institute Thika Technical Training Institute]. He would also author Kenya’s first post-secondary school book on Mathematics, Applied Mathematics for Craft Engineering.{{cite web|url=http://maktaba.ku.ac.ke/cgi-bin/koha/opac-detail.pl?biblionumber=99353 |title=Kenyatta University Library catalog › Details for: Applied mathematics for craft engineering |publisher=Maktaba.ku.ac.ke |date=2014-01-09 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} ==Entrepreneurship== Dr. Gicharu has also previously worked as a lecturer at Thika Technical Training Institute. In 1995, he earned a British Council scholarship to study Managing Enterprise Development at Cranfield University, [[United Kingdom|Britain]]. When he came back he established Kenya Entrepreneurship Promotion Programme (KEPP), which provided micro-loans and training to young [[Entrepreneurship|entrepreneurs]]. His seed capital was only Ksh20,000 (US$220). KEPP later started offering training in [[Computer|computers]] and changed its name to Thika School of Management Studies (TSMS), with introduction of [[Management]] courses. Gradually, TSMS increased its student enrolment and the number of courses. The type of courses it offered was determined by the [[job]] demands of the day and with the explosion in use of information science and [[technology]], TSMS changed its name to Thika Institute of Technology (TIT) in 2003. That same year, Dr. Gicharu, resolved that Science training would be the backbone of TIT. He made a blind trip to [[India]], on scanty information that at the [[Punjab State]], they were assembling [[Science]] equipment in cottage industries that was relatively affordable. Dr. Gicharu immediately purchased the equipment. TIT was the first private college in [[Kenya]] to be accredited to offer the Diploma programme in [[Pharmacy]]. In 2017, Gicharu was noted to have a keen interest in venturing into the media within Kenya, having already started a television and radio station in Rwanda. Gicharu and Tom Mshindi (Editor in Chief of [[Nation Media Group]]) hold controlling shares in 360 mediahttp://nairobilawmonthly.com/index.php/2018/06/05/media-like-false-preachers/ headed by former [[Nation Media Group]] reporter Samwel Born Maina. The firm was set up by Gicharu and team to “disrupt the media relations sector in Kenya, especially in an election year.” http://www.360media.co.ke/?p=1640 Gicharu’s 360 Media has become linked to the scandal involving [[Cambridge Analytica]] developing online campaigns in the 2017 Kenyan elections portraying “[[Raila Odinga]] as a blood-thirsty individual who is also sympathetic to [[Al-Shabaab (militant group)|Al-Shabaab]] and having no development agenda,” whilst portraying the incumbent President Kenyatta as “tough on terrorism, and being good for the economy.”http://nairobilawmonthly.com/index.php/2018/06/05/media-like-false-preachers/ Gicharu has recently gone on to self-fund TV47 and Beats 47 in Kenya, new television and radio stations, via his company Cape Media, headed by his son Kevin Gicharu.https://businesstoday.co.ke/mku-founder-launches-tv-radio-station/ ==University== In 2008, the Institute was awarded a Letter of Interim Authority by the Commission for University Education in Kenya, to operate as an independent university under the name Mount Kenya University. The university was granted a full Charter status in 2011. At the age of 46 years, Dr. Gicharu became the youngest Kenyan to have established a chartered university. The only other indigenous Chartered university was started by the former President H.E Daniel Arap Moi. Mount Kenya University, with 16 Campuses and Centres in Kenya, Rwanda, Somaliland, Tanzania, Burundi and Uganda employs over 3,000 people and has a student population of about 50,000. The University is a member of Inter-university Council of East Africa and the Association of Commonwealth Universities. ==Awards== *"1st Class Chief of the Order of the Burning Spear (CBS)." The highest award a civilian can get in Kenya. He was accorded the title by H.E the President of the Republic of Kenya in 2013 in recognition of his contribution to the growth of tertiary education in Kenya. *"2015 World Entrepreneur of the Year Hall of Fame" *"2014 [[Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year Award|Eastern Africa Ernst and Young Entrepreneur of the Year]]" *"Doctor of Science" - Received from [[Gulu University]] *"Outstanding Alumni" - Received from his alma mater, [[Kenyatta University]] *"Superlative Trailblazer Award" - Awarded by the Marketing Society of Kenya ==References== {{cite web|last=Wainaina |first=James |url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201410271940.html |title=Kenya: How Gicharu Started M KU With Sh19,000 |publisher=allAfrica.com |date=2014-10-27 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.howwemadeitinafrica.com/meet-the-boss-simon-gicharu-founder-mount-kenya-university/25206 |title=Meet the Boss: Simon Gicharu, founder, Mount Kenya University |publisher=Howwemadeitinafrica.com |date=2013-03-27 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} [http://mediamaxnetwork.co.ke/peopledaily/114769/uganda-university-awards-mku-founder] {{dead link|date=June 2015}} {{cite web|url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/ef9a136e-603f-11e4-88d1-00144feabdc0.html |accessdate=6 June 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150530085604/http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/ef9a136e-603f-11e4-88d1-00144feabdc0.html |archivedate=30 May 2015 }} {{cite web|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/business/article/2000121416/simon-gicharu-moved-to-rural-electrification |title=Standard Digital News : : Business - Simon Gicharu moved to Rural Electrification |publisher=Standardmedia.co.ke |date=2014-05-17 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|last=Mbaka |first=James |url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/article/2000122090/simon-gicharu-promises-24hr-services-at-rea |title=Standard Digital News - Kenya : Simon Gicharu promises 24hr services at REA |publisher=Standardmedia.co.ke |date=2014-05-23 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web |url=http://universitytimesafrica.com/index.php/latest-news/207-gulu-awards-mku-founder-honorary-doctorate |title=Why Gulu awarded MKU founder honorary doctorate |publisher=Universitytimesafrica.com |date= |accessdate=2015-06-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150621164757/http://universitytimesafrica.com/index.php/latest-news/207-gulu-awards-mku-founder-honorary-doctorate# |archive-date=21 June 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} {{cite web|url=http://www.mku.ac.ke/index.php/about-mku/2013-10-03-05-37-34/board-of-governors/153-word-from-the-chairman-the-mku-chairman-mr-simon-gicharu |title=Word from the Chairman - The MKU Chairman: Mr. Simon Gicharu |publisher=Mku.ac.ke |date= |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|last=Kinoti |first=Martin |url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/article/2000164690/why-and-when-should-one-choose-a-career/ |title=Standard Digital News - Kenya : Why and when should one choose a career? |publisher=Standardmedia.co.ke |date=2015-06-05 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|last=Muchangi |first=John |url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201505150645.html |title=Africa's Future Lies With Our Universities - Gicharu |publisher=allAfrica.com |date=2015-05-14 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/business/article/2000163180/to-develop-kenya-needs-technology-skills-to-use-the-billions-from-donors |title=Standard Digital News : : Business - To develop, Kenya needs technology skills to use the billions from donors |publisher=Standardmedia.co.ke |date=2015-05-23 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|url=http://www.capitalfm.co.ke/business/2015/04/mku-founder-named-regional-entrepreneur-of-the-year-by-ey/ |title=MKU founder named regional entrepreneur of the year by EY | Capital Business |publisher=Capitalfm.co.ke |date= |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.nation.co.ke/news/education/Career-educationist-lands-in-Hall-of-Fame/-/2643604/2740648/-/11p29ywz/-/index.html |title=Career educationist lands in Hall of Fame - Education | Daily Nation |publisher=Nation.co.ke |date=2014-05-21 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|last=Maichuhie |first=Kamau |url=http://www.standardmedia.co.ke/article/2000164644/mount-kenya-university-founder-inducted-into-hall-of-fame |title=Standard Digital News - Kenya : Mount Kenya University founder inducted into Hall of Fame |publisher=Standardmedia.co.ke |date=2015-06-05 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.magazinereel.com/gicharu-mku-founder-to-be-inducted-into-the-hall-of-fame/ |title=Gicharu, MKU Founder to be Inducted into 'The Hall of Fame.' - Magazine Reel | The Best Kenyan Campus News SiteMagazine Reel | The Best Kenyan Campus News Site |publisher=Magazine Reel |date= |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.coastweek.com/3816-extra-03.htm |title=The most from the coast |publisher=Coastweek |date=2015-04-30 |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|author= |url=http://www.capitalfm.co.ke/campus/mku-sets-aside-sh300m-for-a-tower-campus-in-kisumu/ |title=MKU sets aside Sh300M for a tower campus in Kisumu | Capital Campus |publisher=Capitalfm.co.ke |date= |accessdate=2015-06-21}} {{cite web|last=Samora |first=Mwaura |url=http://www.sde.co.ke/thenairobian/article/2000159341/i-picked-coffee-to-supplement-family-income-founder-of-mt-kenya-university |title=Entertainment News - {{Infobox person |name = Tuna Aktürk |image = |image_size = |caption = [[Balıkesirspor]] [[President]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1977|9|22}} |birth_place = [[Balıkesir]], [[Turkey]] |nickname(s) = |residence = [[Balıkesir]], [[Turkey]] |nationality = {{flagicon|TUR}} [[Turkey]] |known_for = [[Balıkesirspor]] President
[[Balıkesir|Balıkesir Mayority]] Vice-Mayor |alma_mater = [[Balıkesir University|Balıkesir University, Faculty of Engineering and Architecture]] |occupation = [[Civil Engineering]] |home_town = |predecessor = |successor = |signature = |website = }} '''Tuna Aktürk''' (born 22 September 1977 in [[Balıkesir]]) is [[Balıkesir|Balıkesir Vice-Mayor]][http://www.balikesir.gen.tr/Haberler/HaberDetay.asp?id=6561 Tuna Aktürk is new Vice-Mayor] and [[Balıkesirspor]] President.[http://www.haberler.gen.al/2010-06-08/balikesirsporun-yeni-baskani-belediye-baskan-yardimcisi-akturk/ Tuna Aktürk voted new President] He has a degree in [[civil engineering]][http://www.balikesir.bel.tr/bulten.php?siras=1177 Tuna Aktürk] from [[Balıkesir University|Balıkesir University, Faculty of Engineering and Architecture]].[http://www.medya73.com/balikesir-belediyesinde-yeni-atamalar-haberi-18363.html New Vice-Mayors] He is the largest shareholder and board member of Veta Yapi Construction Company . ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.balikesir.bel.tr Balikesir Mayority Web Page] *[http://www.balikesirspor.org.tr Balikesirspor Web Page] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Akturk, Tuna}} [[Category:1977 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Balıkesir]] [[Category:Turkish businesspeople]] [[Category:Turkish football chairmen and investors]] [[Category:Balıkesir Lisesi alumni]] [[Category:Balıkesir University alumni]] [[Category:Turkish civil engineers]] [[Category:Balıkesirspor]] {{Turkey-footy-bio-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=March 2018}} {{Use British English|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox university |name= Warwick Business School |logo = |image_name = [[File:Warwick Business School logo.svg|150px]] |established= 1967 |city= [[Coventry]], [[London]] |country= [[United Kingdom]] |coor= {{Coord|52.3821|-1.5655|display=inline,title|type:edu_region:GB}} |type= [[Public University|Public]] [[Business School]] |website=[http://www.wbs.ac.uk/ www.wbs.ac.uk] |dean=[[Andy Lockett]] |staff=319 (173 academic, 131 professional support, 15 visiting) |students=7,539 (including 98 visiting/exchange) |undergrad=1,186 |postgrad=3,162 (2,726 MBA and MPA, 438 specialist masters) |doctoral=182 |location=[[Coventry]] & [[London]], [[Europe]] |campus=Semi-rural & Urban }}
'''Warwick Business School''' ('''WBS''') is an academic department of the Faculty of Social Sciences of [[University of Warwick|Warwick University]], originally established in 1967 as the School of Industrial and [[Business Studies]]. It is one of the most prestigious and highly selective [[business school]]s in the world.<ref>{{cite web|title=Financial Times Business School Rankings 2012|url=http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/european-business-school-rankings-2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Which MBA - The Economist 2014|url=http://www.economist.com/whichmba/full-time-mba-ranking?page=3}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Poets & Quants: Business School Rankings 2012|url=http://poetsandquants.com/2013/07/25/warwick-business-school/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Find MBA: Business School Rankings 2013|url=http://www.find-mba.com/university/465/warwick-business-school-wbs-university-of-warwick}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Business Insider: The World's Best Business Schools Rankings 2013|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/best-business-schools-in-the-world-2013-7?op=1}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://aquila5.iseg.ulisboa.pt/aquila/getFile.do?method=getFile&fileId=357082 |title=CEO Magazine: Global MBA Super Table 2013 |access-date=3 February 2014 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140221103040/https://aquila5.iseg.ulisboa.pt/aquila/getFile.do?method=getFile&fileId=357082 |archive-date=21 February 2014 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://uk.businessinsider.com/the-best-value-mbas-from-elite-european-business-schools-2015-7 Business Insider: These are the 19 best-value MBAs from Europe's elite business schools]</ref> Due to the school's historical international outlook its alumni hold leadership positions in corporate, governmental and academic institutions around the globe.<ref name="THE">[https://www.timeshighereducation.co.uk/news/the-100-most-international-universities-in-the-world-2015/2018125.article?nopaging=1 Times Higher Education: The 100 most international universities in the world 2015]</ref><ref>[http://www.topmba.com/institution/warwick-business-school QS Top MBA: Warwick Business School]</ref>
The Business School offers [[undergraduate]], [[postgraduate]] and [[PhD]] degree programs, as well as non-degree executive education for individuals and companies. Its [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]] program, known as the Warwick MBA, is offered as a one-year Full-Time program, an Executive MBA and by Distance Learning ([[blended learning]]).
WBS University of Warwick [[campus university|campus]] is sited on the border of the city of [[Coventry]] and the county of [[Warwickshire]] in a semi-rural [[green belt]] location. WBS [[London]] campus is located in [[The Shard]] Tower, currently the tallest building in the [[European Union]].<ref name="ft.com">[http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/2/847dcac6-89b7-11e3-8829-00144feab7de.html#axzz2wce3jM5x Financial Times: Warwick Business School to open London campus in the Shard]</ref>
[[File:Warwick Business School Extension.JPG|thumb|WBS Latest Extension Building in 2015]]
[[File:The Shard Opening Light Show, London - July 2012.jpg|thumb|[[The Shard]], where WBS houses its [[London]] campus]]
[[File:Warwick Business School Scarman road view.JPG|thumb|WBS view from Scarman road]]
==History== Warwick's School of Industrial and Business Studies (SIBS) was founded in 1967, with Brian Houlden as Chair, a total of five academic staff and 24 students across three programmes (MSc Management & Business Studies, MSc Management Science & Operational Research, Doctoral programme). It quickly gained a reputation for excellent research, particularly in the field of [[industrial relations]]. The Industrial Relations Research Unit, founded by [[Hugh Clegg (industrial relations)|Hugh Clegg]] in 1970 focused on achieving a better understanding of workplace industrial relations in general and workplace trade unionism in particular, in a time when the UK was perceived to suffer greatly from industrial strife and poor economic performance.
In 1981, the MSc in Management was renamed the Warwick MBA. At its 20th anniversary in 1987, SIBS was renamed Warwick Business School. The department had grown to over 100 staff, 815 students and 11 programs. In 1997, following expansion of the distance learning MBA in particular, the staff tally was over 260, with 3,160 students across 17 programs.
In 2000, a new Executive MBA teaching centre was opened, the first of four phases of development of new premises for WBS. Further phases opened in 2001 and 2006, increasing the teaching capacity of WBS dramatically. This was followed by aggressive recruitment of academic faculty. In 2006, there were a total of 319 staff and 7,539 students across 25 degree programs, from over 100 countries worldwide.
In September 2014, WBS opened a second campus in [[The Shard]] Tower in [[London]] to teach its MSc Finance, MSc Human Resource Management and Employment Relations along with its Executive MBA courses.<ref name="ft.com"/>
In August 2015, WBS opened Phase 3b of its Scarman Road building on The University of Warwick campus. The £30m extension <ref>[http://www.wbs.ac.uk/news/interior-of-30m-wbs-extension-revealed/.html Interior of £30m WBS extension revealed]{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> houses a 292-seat lecture theatre with a removable stage, a 120-seat lecture theatre which contains swivel chairs to allow for group work, a Behavioural Science Laboratory, a 150-seater café, nine seminar rooms, undergraduate and post-graduate learning spaces and four open plan offices for management and support staff plus a new reception.
==Research== Warwick Business School is consistently recognised as one of the world's leading research institutions in business and management. In the 2014 [[Research Excellence Framework]] more than 80 per cent of WBS’s research output has been judged ‘World Leading’ or ‘Internationally Excellent’.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.wbs.ac.uk/news/wbs-ranked-fifth-for-research-output-and-third-for-research-power-in-the-uk-ref-2014/ | location=London | work=WBS | title=WBS ranked fifth for research output and third for research power in the UK REF 2014 | date=2014-12-18}}</ref> The 2008 [[Research Assessment Exercise]] positioned Warwick in the top ranks for business and management research <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/education/table/2008/dec/18/rae-2008-business-and-management-studies | location=London | work=The Guardian | title=RAE (Education),Business and management studies (Education subject),Research (Higher education),Higher education (Universities etc.),Education | date=2008-12-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/2/0b94b366-2f46-11e3-8cb2-00144feab7de.html#axzz2y1FLBUnv | location=London | work=Financial Times | title=Research review puts UK schools in scramble to hire top talent | date=2013-10-27}}</ref> WBS is included in the worlds Top 100 Business Schools that prioritize sustainability education by supporting core curriculum choices, dedicated institutes, and relevant faculty research.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.corporateknights.com/channels/education/2014_sustainable_mba/ | location=Canada | work=Corporate Knights | title=Introduction and results for the 2014 Global 100 Sustainable MBA ranking | date=2014-08-10}}</ref> WBS is also included in the UTD Top 100 worldwide business school rankings based on research contributions.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://jindal.utdallas.edu/the-utd-top-100-business-school-research-rankings/worldRankings#20092013 | location=USA | work=The University of Texas at Dallas | title=The UTD Top 100 Worldwide Business School Rankings Based on Research Contributions (All Journals) | date=2014-03-04}}</ref> Its one of only 3 UK business schools to be awarded the top five-star (5*) research rating by the [[Higher Education Funding Council for England]], the others being [[London Business School]] and [[Lancaster University Management School|Lancaster School of Management]].<ref name="rae">{{Cite news|url=http://www.hero.ac.uk/rae/rae_dynamic.cfm?myURL=http://195.194.167.103/Results/byuoa/uoa43.htm|publisher=HERO|title=2001 Research Assessment Exercise Results, Unit of Assessment: 43 Business and Management Studies|accessdate=2008-02-18}}{{dead link|date=March 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> WBS is a founding member of The Academy of Business in Society where [[primary research]] can be applied directly into business practises.
As of 2016, 100% of the WBS academic [[faculty (teaching staff)|faculty]] have a doctoral degree, 54% are active researchers in the top 45 academic and practitioner journals whilst 76% are international academics.<ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/warwick-business-school FT: Business Education: Faculty 2013]</ref><ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/warwick-business-school FT: Business Education: Idea Generation 2014]</ref> All academics are members of a teaching subject group, a research centre or unit, and often both. Each teaching subject group has a group convenor or head, and devolved group management. Each research centre has a director, and has similarly devolved management. Research centres may have a board with external representation to ensure practical relevance of research strategy.
=== Rankings & Reputation === {{Infobox business school rankings | FT = 25 | Economist = 18 | BI = 26 | CNNExpansion = 25 | BWg = | Forbes = | QSglobal = 26 | THES = 23 | USNWRg = | QS_E = }} In its 2015 "Which MBA" ranking research [[The Economist]] ranks the Warwick MBA 18th best in the world, 5th in [[Europe]] and 1st in the UK.<ref>[http://www.economist.com/whichmba/university-warwick-warwick-business-school/2015 The Economist "Which MBA" Rankings 2015]</ref><ref name="rankings.ft.com">[http://rankings.ft.com/exportranking/online-mba-ranking-2014/pdf= Financial Times Online MBA Ranking 2014]{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> [[Financial Times]] Global MBA Ranking 2014 placed the Warwick MBA: 25th in the World, 10th in Europe and 4th in UK.<ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/global-mba-ranking-2014 Financial Times: Global MBA Rankings 2014]</ref> [[The Guardian]] University Guide ranks Warwick Business School second only after [[University of Oxford|Oxford's]] Saïd Business School Business and Management studies for 2014.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/education/table/2013/jun/04/university-guide-business-management-studies The Guardian: University guide 2014: League table for Business and Management studies]</ref> [[QS World University Rankings]] and [[Financial Times|FT]] rank the Warwick MBA by [[blended learning]] 2nd in the world - just below [[IE Business School]] and above [[Kelley School of Business]].<ref name="rankings.ft.com"/><ref>[http://www.topmba.com/mba-rankings/online-mba-rankings/2014#sorting=rank+custom=317561+order=desc+search= The QS Distance/Online Global MBA Ranking 2014]</ref> In the MBA50's [[Europe]]an Premiership 2014 Ranking of Rankings Warwick MBA is ranked in the Top 10 along with [[London Business School]], [[INSEAD]], [[HEC Paris]] and [[Cambridge Judge Business School]].<ref>[http://www.mba50.com/mba50-com-premiership-2014-european-b-school-ranking-of-rankings/#sthash.ecJWHf6H.dpuf MBA50: Premiership 2014: European Business School Ranking of Rankings]</ref>
The Warwick Executive MBA was ranked 19th in the world and 1st in the UK (single schools) in 2014 by the [[Financial Times]].<ref name="emba2013">{{Cite news|url=http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/emba-rankings-2006|publisher=FT.com |title=EMBA rankings 2013|accessdate=2014-01-17}}</ref> [[Eduniversal]] ranked Warwick Business School 17th in the world and in the Top Tier (5 Palmes League) of Business Schools in 2014.<ref>[http://www.eduniversal-ranking.com/business-school-university-ranking-5palms.html ED Universal Business Schools Raking by Palmes] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150729153506/http://www.eduniversal-ranking.com/business-school-university-ranking-5palms.html |date=29 July 2015 }}</ref> In 2015 the [[Academic Ranking of World Universities|ARWU Shanghai University Ranking]] placed Warwick University 34th in the world for [[Economics]] and Business Studies (2014 33rd).
Financial Times Global MBA Ranking placed the Warwick MBA: 28th in the World, 10th in Europe and 4th in UK for 2013.<ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/global-mba-ranking-2013 Financial Times Global MBA Ranking 2013]</ref> [[Business Insider]] ranks the Warwick Business School 26th in the world in 2013.<ref>[http://www.businessinsider.com/best-business-schools-in-the-world-2013-7?op=1 Business Insider: The World's Best Business Schools 2013]</ref> [[Forbes]] ranked the Warwick MBA as the 7th best program outside the USA based on return on investment, and the 6th best one-year program in 2013.<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/colleges/university-of-warwick/warwick-business-school/ Forbes: Best International Business Schools]</ref><ref>[https://www.forbes.com/business-schools/list/international/ Forbes: Best Business Schools Rankings]</ref> [[Financial Times]] Global MBA Ranking 2012 placed Warwick MBA: 27th in the World, 9th in Europe, 4th in UK, 3rd in the World for Best Value for Money.<ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/global-mba-ranking-2013 Financial Times Global MBA Ranking]</ref>
The FT also rates WBS as the UK's fastest rising Business School in the same year.<ref>[http://rankings.ft.com/businessschoolrankings/european-business-school-rankings-2012 Rankings FT: European Business School Rankings 2012]</ref> [[América Economía]] ranks WBS's Global MBA as the 44th Best in the world for 2011.<ref>[http://rankings.americaeconomia.com/2011/mba/ranking-mba-global.php América Economía: Global MBA Rankings 2011]</ref> [[Bloomberg Businessweek]] ranks Warwick Business School as one of the Best Business schools in Europe in 2010.<ref>[http://images.businessweek.com/ss/10/03/0317_top_europe_business_schools/24.htm Business Week: Europe's Top B-Schools 2010]</ref> CNN Expansion ranked the Warwick MBA 25th in the world in its 2010 "Best MBA in the World" report.<ref>[http://www.cnnexpansion.com/expansion/2010/02/14/rankinglos-mejores-mba-en-el-mundo-2010 Best MBA in the World]</ref> The [[Economist Intelligence Unit]] ranked the Warwick MBA by distance learning 3rd in the world while QS ranked it 1st in UK and 2nd in the world.<ref name="eiudl2008">{{Cite news |url=http://mba.eiu.com/index.asp?layout=view_article&eiu_article_id=1782965163 |publisher=Which MBA |title=Top 10 Distance Learning Programs |accessdate=2008-02-18 }}</ref>
[[The Economist]] also placed Warwick's Full-Time MBA program 29th in the world, top 10 in Europe and 6th in the world for the final salary of its graduates; ahead of other top international business schools such as [[Saïd Business School]], [[Yale School of Management]] and [[ESADE]].<ref>[http://www.economist.com/whichmba Economist: Which MBA]</ref> The school consistently ranks in HighFliers Top 10 universities most-often targeted by the "Top 100 employers" such as [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], [[Airbus]], [[BBC]], [[Google]], [[HSBC]], [[McKinsey & Company|McKinsey]] the [[European Commission]] and many others.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.highfliers.co.uk/download/GMReport13.pdf |title=High Fliers Research: The Graduate Market in 2013 |access-date=16 January 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150302013019/http://www.highfliers.co.uk/download/GMReport13.pdf |archive-date=2 March 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.highfliers.co.uk/download/GMReport14.pdf |title=High Fliers Research: The Graduate Market in 2014 |access-date=16 January 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150226004827/http://www.highfliers.co.uk/download/GMReport14.pdf |archive-date=26 February 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://www.highfliers.co.uk/download/2015/graduate_market/GMReport15.pdf High Fliers Research: The Graduate Market in 2015]</ref>
In 2016, the school was ranked the #8 MBA program in the world for social and environmental impact by ''[[Corporate Knights]]'' magazine.<ref name="Corporate Knights MBA Rankings">{{cite web |url = http://www.corporateknights.com/reports/2016-better-world-mba-ranking/2016-better-world-mba-results-14763351/ |title = 2016 Better World MBA results |publisher = [[Corporate Knights]] |accessdate = 2016-10-29 }}</ref>
==Accreditation== In 2000, WBS became the first UK business school to hold [[Triple accreditation]]: The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business [[AACSB]], the Association of MBAs [[Association of MBAs|AMBA]] and the European Quality Improvement System [[EQUIS]]. <ref>[https://www.efmd.org/index.php/accreditation-main/equis/accredited-schools "AACSB ''Schools Accredited in Business''"]</ref><ref>[http://www.mbaworld.com/Business-Schools/Business-School-Search/Business-school-detail.aspx?s=5eY1lqGxQ2H5i7iJyMYvtj9PwQtsbylRAUmMTsKnDg9nNqO5lsJUSg%3d%3d "Association of MBAs (AMBA), ''Accredited MBA Programs''"]</ref><ref>[http://www.efmd.org/component/efmd/?cmsid=040929sqku "EQUIS, ''Accredited Members''"]</ref>
==Admission== With a median GMAT score of 660 and an average admission rate of 29%, Warwick remains highly selective.<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/colleges/university-of-warwick/warwick-business-school/ Forbes: Warwick Business School]</ref> However, the school strategically seeks for critical thinking skills along with creativity in its applicant pool while maintaining a very robust international outlook.<ref>[https://www2.warwick.ac.uk/study/postgraduate/courses/depts/wbs/msc/mba/ Warwick: The Warwick MBA]</ref> A typical ratio on the MBA is 36% British, 14% EU and 50% non-EU while the median age is 31.<ref>[http://www.wbs.ac.uk/courses/mba/full-time/ WBS: Full-time MBA]</ref> Crucially, the make-up of each MBA cohort includes a mix of skills as the school holistically investigates candidate profiles including academics, professional experience and test scores and not any one factor in isolation.<ref>[http://www.topmba.com/admissions/mba-admissions-qa-warwick-business-school QS Top MBA: MBA Admissions Q&A: Warwick Business School]</ref><ref>[http://www.wbs.ac.uk/courses/mba/faq/ WBS: MBA: Frequently Asked Questions]</ref><ref>[http://find-mba.com/board/general-forum/warwick-lse-imperial-msc-management-admission-with-a-low-gpa-but-high-gmat-37821?latest=true Find MBA: Warwick, LSE, Imperial Msc Management admission with a low GPA but High Gmat]</ref>
==Academic Alliances== Warwick Business School is a member of the Partnership in International Management network (PIMS).<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.pimnetwork.org/member-schools/global-map-of-member-schools |title="PIM Business School Members" |access-date=9 December 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151118121009/http://www.pimnetwork.org/member-schools/global-map-of-member-schools |archive-date=18 November 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==Notable people==
===Academic Staff=== * [[Steve Alpern]]: Professor of Operational Research * [[Söhnke M. Bartram]]: Professor of Finance * [[Jonathan Bate|Sir Jonathan Bate]]: Fellow of Creativity and [[Provost (education)|Provost]] of [[Worcester College, Oxford]] * [[Colin Crouch]]: Emeritus Professor of Governance and Public Management * [[Graham Loomes]]: Professor of Economics and Behavioural Science * [[Tobias Preis]]: Associate Professor of Behavioral Science and Finance * [[Andrew Sentance]] CBE: Professor of Practice in Sustainable Business, Senior Economic Advisor at [[PriceWaterhouseCoopers|PwC]], Former Monetary Policy Committee member of The [[Bank of England]] * [[Mark P. Taylor]]: Professor of Finance, former Senior Economist at the [[International Monetary Fund]] and [[Bank of England]] * [[Catherine Waddams]]: formerly Director of the Centre for Management under Regulation
===Alumni=== * Alberto Grippo, CEO of [[Fiat Automobiles|Fiat Group Automobiles]] Capital * [[Andy Haldane]], Chief Economist and the Executive Director of Monetary Analysis and Statistics at the [[Bank of England]] * [[Aung Tun Thet]] , [[Myanmar]] [[Economist]] and [[Management Consultant]] * [[Bernardo Hees]], CEO of [[H. J. Heinz Company|Heinz]] & former CEO of [[Burger King Corporation|Burger King]] * [[Nigel Wilson (businessman)|Nigel Wilson]], CEO of [[Legal & General]] Group plc * [[Judith Clegg]], founder and CEO of Takeout, and founder of The Glasshouse * Stefan Barden, Ex Consultant at [[McKinsey & Company]], CEO at [[Northern Foods]] and now CEO at [[Wiggle Ltd]] * Peter Amango, CEO of [[Zenith Bank]] * [[Linda Jackson (businesswoman)|Linda Jackson]], CEO of [[Citroën]] * [[Idris Jala]], [[Government of Malaysia]] Minister & former CEO of [[Malaysia Airlines]] * [[Gus O'Donnell, Baron O'Donnell|Lord Gus O'Donnell]], former [[Cabinet Secretary]] and Head of the [[Home Civil Service]] of U.K * [[Max McKeown]], author, consultant and researcher specializing in [[innovation]] strategy, leadership and culture * [[George Yankey]], CEO of [[Ghana Gas Company]] & former Minister of Health * [[Reza Moghadam]], Director of the [[Europe]]an Department of the [[International Monetary Fund]] * [[Sean Clarke]], CEO of [[Asda]] supermarket retailer (a [[Walmart]] subsidiary) * [[Mahmoud Mohieldin]], [[World Bank]] Special Envoy on Millennium Development Goals * [[Brian Paddick|Lord Brian Paddick]], former [[Commissioner]], [[Metropolitan Police]], and [[Mayor of London|London Mayoral]] candidate for the [[Liberal Democrats (UK)|Liberal Democrats]] in 2008 and 2012 * Jens Papperitz, CEO of [[Siemens Healthcare]] Instruments * [[Ralf Speth]], CEO of [[Jaguar Land Rover]]
===Deans=== *Brian Houlden (1967–1973) *Roger Fawthrop (1973–1976) *Derek Waterworth (1976–1978) *Robert Dyson (1978–1981) *Thom Watson (1981–1983) *[[George Bain (academic)|Sir George Bain]] (1983–1989) *Robin Wensley (1989–1994) *Robert Galliers (1994–1998) *Robert Dyson (1998–2000) *Howard Thomas (2000–2010) *[[Mark P. Taylor]] (2010–2016) *Andy Lockett (2016 - present)
